skillTree.localised_description: Not all who wander are lost.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can pass through trees.

skillTree.localised_description: The natural state of the world is that of untouched wilderness, free from the meddling of all outsiders.

effects.description:
Attrition: -50% casualties suffered from Chaos attrition
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: From between the branches they cameâ€¦

effects.description:
Charge Bonus: +15 for Things in the Woods, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts and Forest Animal units
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Things in the Woods, Incarnate Elemental of Beasts and Forest Animal units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A Kislevite army without vodka is like a bear without teeth and claws.
Our gods stand with us in the battlefield, protecting us from the Dark Powers.

effects.description:
Magic Resistance: +8% for Torch Bearers of Dazh, Sons of ursun, Claws of Ursun, and Hammers of Tor units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: We have endured the attacks of the servants of the Dark Powers for centuries, and we will keep doing it as long as one of us still breaths.

effects.description:
Physical Resistance: +2% for Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Most Kislevites are used to walk and ride days on puruit of roaming Chaos warbands and other invaders.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Malediction upon malediction, the curse weighs heavily on those who dare trespass.

effects.description: Effect duration: +100% for spells that debuff the enemy

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -4 for spells that debuff the enemy

skillTree.localised_description: Directing covens of Hags to do the work of the wild allows Ostankya to weave greater rituals befitting of her station.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +20

skillTree.localised_description: The citizenry of rural Kislev have a begrudging-yet-thankful relationship with the Hags, wherein proper respect begets a startling lack of misfortune.

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Hag Witch
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: Never attack a witch close to the heart of her power.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5
	(characters's army when in own territory)

Charge bonus: +15
	(characters's army when in own territory)

skillTree.localised_description: Ostankya speaks no complicated truths, no poetic musings. She simply lays bare the natural world and brings a surety of purpose to her followers.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve: +2 per turn
	(armies in region)

skillTree.localised_description: "You'd better start believing in fairy tales, 'cos you're in one!"

effects.description: Attacks cause "The Curse of Anraheir" effect, reducing combat potential
Upgrades "Spirit Bear" with a deadly lingering damage effect

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description:
Attribute: Causes Fear when fighting against Humans
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above
Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Flock of Doom"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Flock of Doom Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.
A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
When cast this spell enfeebles enemy minds; they feel the crushing weight of reality bearing down upon them.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Enfeebling Foe"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Enfeebling Foe Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The Wizard destroys their enemies from within, corroding foes' minds with doubt and crisis.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "The Withering"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Withering Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Withering Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Sounding a gnarled horn, the caster summons a glowing amber spear and hurls it at the foe with uncanny accuracy.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target
Requires line of sight to the target

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Amber Spear"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Amber Spear Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Amber Spear Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Nebulous nature spirits assail the foe, clawing at them with hands not nearly as insubstantial as they appear.

Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Curse of Anraheir Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: The supernatural solution is often the best; weapons materialise before the caster's allies, allowing them to slice through flesh, soul, and consciousness.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Okkam's Mindrazor"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Okkam's Mindrazor Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Again, again, again! We'll practice this until your fingers bleed!"

skillTree.localised_description: The warriors of the north carry conflict in their blood, a legacy left by the Khan-Kings and Khan-Queens of old.

skillTree.localised_description: Descended of the proud horse-warriors of the Gospodar, all Kislevites are born to the saddle like their ancestors before them.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

factionEffects.localised_description: Magic festers deep in the woods, wherein spirits dance and witches weave the darkest of spells. Chief among them, Mother Ostankya lurks among the trees, a nightmarish bedtime story to any who would disturb her.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +1 for each resource-producing building

	(all armies)

	(all armies)

items.colour_text: Centred within the Motherâ€™s circlet of claws, an ancient artefact suspended in ever-frozen ice strengthens her kinship with the sentinel-spirits of the land.
Simmering with powerful arcane brews, the hag's curses and incantations take shape to summon forth the spirit-magic of the land.
